inference:
The angles $x+26^\circ$ and $2x+10^\circ$ are adjacent angles that form a right angle.  Therefore, their sum is $90^\circ$.
$$(x+26) + (2x+10) = 90$$
$$3x + 36 = 90$$
$$3x = 90 - 36$$
$$3x = 54$$
$$x = \frac{54}{3}$$
$$x = 18$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{18}$
ground_truth: Since the two angles together form a line, we have $(x + 26^\circ)+ (2x+10^\circ) = 180^\circ$.  Simplifying gives $3x + 36^\circ = 180^\circ$, so $3x = 144^\circ$ and $x = \boxed{48^\circ}$.
